title: How to Make a Mountain Dew Slushie

steps.headline: Fill the cup about 3/8-1/4 full with clean snow.
steps.description: If snow is not readily available, use shaved ice.

steps.headline: Open the bottle or can of Mountain Dew.
Pour Mountain Dew in the cup with the snow/shaved ice.
steps.description: Depending on how much snow/shaved ice you put in the cup, you may want to vary the amount of Mountain Dew.

steps.headline: Use the spoon or stirring stick to stir the mix.
Pour the half cup of ice into the blender.
Pour in the cup of Mountain Dew into the blender.
Pour Mountain Dew into a freezer-proof cup or container.
Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Allow to freeze for one to two hours.

steps.headline: Remove.
steps.description: Pour into the glass for serving.

steps.headline: Mix the tea and Mountain Dew in a freezer-proof container.
Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Leave for one to two hours.

text: Shaved Ice Mountain Dew Slushie Fill the cup about 3/8-1/4 full with clean snow. If snow is not readily available, use shaved ice. Open the bottle or can of Mountain Dew.  Pour Mountain Dew in the cup with the snow/shaved ice. Depending on how much snow/shaved ice you put in the cup, you may want to vary the amount of Mountain Dew. Use the spoon or stirring stick to stir the mix.  Enjoy!  Blended Mountain Dew Slushie Pour the half cup of ice into the blender.  Pour in the cup of Mountain Dew into the blender.  Blend for two minutes.  Pour into a glass. Add a straw. Serve. Enjoy! Very Simple Mountain Dew Slushie Pour Mountain Dew into a freezer-proof cup or container.  Place in the freezer. Allow to freeze for one to two hours. Remove. Pour into the glass for serving. Add a straw. Serve. Mountain Dew and Tea Slushie Mix the tea and Mountain Dew in a freezer-proof container.  Place in the freezer. Leave for one to two hours. Remove from the freezer. Pour into glasses for serving. Add a straw. Serve.
